file_content.text: There are two wires in the maintenance panel, Yuun--one red, one blue. Which should I cut?
Hmm. The red wire suggests danger, threat, even anger, but it sits serene. Its placement demonstrates calm and peace.
The blue wire presents an appearance of cool serenity, but its placement is askew--its twists and turns betray its evil nature.
Yuun believes that the blue wire gives the force field its deadly resolve. Sever it, and your journey can continue in safety.
Cutting the blue wire now.
Copy that. [Cut the blue wire]
I don't see how you can base so much on the wires' positions.
How can you be so sure?
It is the Findsman's way to see the truth, Captain. To find the signs that hide amongst the ordinary.
You're talking nonsense, Yuun.
This is absurd!
Yuun apologizes if Yuun is misunderstood. Clarity and specificity are of great importance.
Yuun is quite certain--the blue wire must be cut.
Let's hope this works.
All right. [Cut the blue wire]
Perfect. The threat is removed, and harmony returned.
Thanks for the assist, Sergeant.
Good call.
Yuun is very proud to be found helpful.
You're an odd guy, Yuun, but I won't argue with results.
Maybe you aren't crazy.
Yuun merely follows the great legacy of Gand's Findsmen. Perhaps these methods will become more understandable with time.
You had fifty-fifty odds of being right. This doesn't prove anything.
A lucky guess--nothing more.
Yuun only intended to provide assistance.
The path to knowledge is cleared! Please proceed, Captain--Yuun will stand by.
I'm not listening to your babble.
No way. [Cut the red wire.]
Captain! How dare this treacherous Imperial machine attempt to harm you? Die, inferior scrap pile!
Captain! Here, sir--let me help you.
Captain! Steady, steady--you're alright.
Hm. Maybe you should listen to his babble, Captain.
Gand is deeply sorry that miscommunication occurred. Gand will endeavor to be clearer in the future.
I don't have time for this!
Forget it! [Shoot the panel.]
Captain! Noble Captain, please--do not expose yourself to unnecessary explosive impacts. I can serve that function quite well!
Sir! Are you alright? Do you require medical attention?
I'll be alright, Dorne, don't worry about it.
Negative.
I'm not sure... you'd better come closer to take a look.
[Flirt] Always.
Sir, please. I was merely concerned for your health.
Ahem. Well, cognitive functions appear normal, at least. No clear sign of physical injury either.
I've been in worse shape than this--I'll manage.
It's nothing I can't handle.
Very well, sir.
Ugh. I was not expecting that to happen.
That hurt.
Here, sir--this should help with the pain.
Ah! You alright, Captain? That looked like it hurt.
Nothing major, Jorgan. Don't worry about it.
I'll be fine.
Could've fooled me. Whatever you say, sir.
Don't get your hopes up, Jorgan--I'm not dead yet.
Hoping for a new job opening?
Good. Now I won't have to explain to General Garza how you blew yourself up.
Aw, Jorgan, you do care.
[Flirt] Worried about me?
Wouldn't be much of a squad without a CO, would we?
Don't get any big ideas, sir.
Ugh. Didn't see that one coming.
That hurt.
Just take it easy, all right? We still got a lot of work to do here.
Ouch. Well, you got the job done, Captain.
Gand is deeply shamed. Clearly, Gand should have been more clear in explaining how to sever the wires.
Next time, Gand will make certain that words are not misunderstood. Deepest apologies, sir.
This unpleasantness is not without benefit, though--the path to knowledge is now cleared. Please proceed, Captain.
This unpleasantness is not without benefit, though--the path to knowledge is now cleared. Please proceed, Captain.
